1_1GkoHb4XqFDbLnxzrZxSzJK7dqnxmGyBRP.body:
> [ulrichard](#comment_6_1PSaHi14Xh4Kjo3yyjDgbRtj4YLQgWV4QJ): On the computer I use the electrum light wallet. It also has an android version, but I never used it.Electrum supports hardware wallets and multisig.Combined that makes for super secure bitcoin storage : https://ulrichard.ch/blog/?p=2035
> For on the go, I use the case hardware walet with GSM built in : http://choosecase.com/

How do you like the case wallet? I saw a review of the build quality and was concerned.

@papul You don't have to host the blockchain to use bitcoin. There are many software and hardware wallets to store your bitcoins. I really liked Bread Wallet and Copay.io. They have bitcoin debit cards as well that work in store. SatoshiTango is one campany that issues Mastercards, and Xapo I believe issues Visa cards.
